abstract: Food prices are expected to remain high this year, bringing them close to the crisis levels that provoked shortages and riots in poor countries three years ago.
snippet: Food prices are expected to remain high this year, bringing them close to the crisis levels that provoked shortages and riots in poor countries three years ago.
lead_paragraph: World food prices continued to rise sharply in December, bringing them close to the crisis levels that provoked shortages and riots in poor countries three years ago, according to newly released United Nations data.

headline.main: U.N. Data Notes Sharp Rise in World Food Prices
headline.print_headline: U.N. Notes Sharp Rise in World Food Prices
